GreatSchools’ Summary Rating provides an overall snapshot of school quality. Ratings follow a 1-10 scale, where top-rated schools are "10s":

  • 5-6 indicate “average”
  • ratings of 7-10 are “above average”

div.class: mobile-toggle-button active font-size-medium tac tav js-choose-school-search

a.data-content-html:
This school has not yet claimed its profile.

School leaders - claim your school's profile to edit general information and share what makes your school unique. Learn more.

1/10
GreatSchools Summary Rating
GreatSchools is a national nonprofit organization. Our new Summary Rating provides a multi-measured reflection of school quality based on the ratings components you see here. Learn more about GreatSchools Ratings.
Rating components Weight Rating/flag
Test Scores 63% 1/10
The GreatSchools Test Score Rating reflects annual state test results for this school compared with scores statewide.
Equity Overview 37% 1/10
The Equity Overview Rating looks at how well this school is serving the needs of its disadvantaged students relative to all its students, compared to other schools in the state, based on test scores provided from the state Department of Education.
Last updated: Oct 29, 2019

div.data-content-html:
Welcome!

You're seeing our new, improved GreatSchools School Profile.

div.div: Welcome! You're seeing our new, improved GreatSchools School Profile.

div.data-content-html:
Welcome!

You're seeing our new, improved GreatSchools School Profile.

div.div: Learn more about this district's school board and how you can get involved.

div.span: This school is rated below average in school quality compared to other schools in Montana. Students here perform below average on state tests, and this school has below average results in how well it’s serving disadvantaged students.

a.data-content-html:
The GreatSchools Test Score Rating reflects annual state test results for this school compared with scores statewide.

Learn more about this rating.

div.span: Find out what state standardized test scores really tell you about a school – and what they don’t.

a.data-content-html:
Email
Facebook
Twitter
Permalink
Copied to clipboard

div.p: Test scores at this school fall far below the state average. This suggests that students at this school are likely not performing at grade level.

hr.p: Test scores are important to look at because they indicate where students are performing compared to grade-level standards. Ask the school what... More it's doing to help students who are behind. Understand what on-track learning looks like, and explore higher-performing schools in your area to find the best opportunities for your child to succeed.

a.data-content-html:
The test scores and state averages we display come from the State Department of Education (DOE). When information is missing in our display, it is because the information was not included in the data we received from the DOE.

Why are grade-level scores sometimes different from the overall score for a subject? Most likely this is due to suppression. States are required to suppress grade/subject data if the number of test-taking students is too small. This can mean that some grade-level scores that are part of the overall score cannot be displayed individually.

Learn more about this rating.

Still have questions? Visit our FAQ page.

GreatSchools profile data sources & information

GreatSchools Test Score Rating

The Test Score Rating examines how students at this school performed on standardized tests compared with other schools in the state. The Test Rating was created using 2017 MT SBAC data from Montana Office of Public Instruction.

Source: GreatSchools; this rating was calculated in 2019 | See more: About this rating

Smarter Balanced Assessment

Math, English

In 2016-2017, students in Montana took the SBAC assessment, which measures grades 3-8 in ELA and Math.

Note: To provide an at-a-glance view of proficiency at this school, we calculate an overall test score for each subject weighted by the number of students tested in each grade.

Source: Montana Office of Public Instruction, 2017

How much do schools and teachers help students grow each year?

Many states publish student growth data to reflect how much progress students are making year-over-year. This state doesn’t publish student growth data. Instead, our Academic Progress Rating estimates student progress by comparing year-over-year test scores by grade and subject at this school compared to all schools in the state that started with similar proficiency levels.

Learn more about this rating.

div.span: How much did this school help its students improve from one year to the next? This rating compares schools with similar proficiency levels to measure student progress over time.

div.a: Update me when new information is published on this school's profile.

a.data-content-html:
The Equity Overview Rating looks at how well this school is serving the needs of its disadvantaged students relative to all its students, compared to other schools in the state, based on test scores provided from the state Department of Education.
Learn more about this rating.

div.span: Is this school offering opportunity for all its students, or leaving some kids behind? Successful schools are working to close the achievement gap.

a.data-content-html:
Email
Facebook
Twitter
Permalink
Copied to clipboard

div.p: Disadvantaged students at this school may be falling far behind other students in the state, and this school may have large achievement gaps.

hr.p: Look at the Race/ethnicity and Low-income sections below to see how different student groups are doing at this school. Are there big gaps?... More These 5 things will help you start a conversation at your school about helping all students succeed.

a.data-content-html:
GreatSchools profile data sources & information

GreatSchools Equity Overview Rating

The Equity Overview Rating looks at how well this school is serving the needs of its disadvantaged students relative to all its students, compared to other schools in the state, based on test scores provided from the state Department of Education. The Equity Rating was created using 2016 demographic data from NCES, and using 2017 MT SBAC data from Montana Office of Public Instruction.

Source: GreatSchools; this rating was calculated in 2019 | See more: About this rating

{"title":"Race/ethnicity","anchor":"Race_ethnicity","analytics_id":"EquityRaceEthnicity","subtitle":"These 5 things will help you start a conversation at your school about helping all students succeed. ","info_text":"This section reflects test scores and other important measures for students at this school across different races/ethnicities.

Note: When the population of a subgroup is too small to provide reliable data, that subgroup does not show up in the display. This may cause certain races/ethnicities to not be included in some charts within this section. ","icon_classes":"icon-pie","sources":"

GreatSchools profile data sources & information

GreatSchools Test Score Rating

The Test Score Rating examines how students at this school performed on standardized tests compared with other schools in the state. The Test Rating was created using 2017 MT SBAC data from Montana Office of Public Instruction.

Source: GreatSchools; this rating was calculated in 2019 | See more: About this rating

Smarter Balanced Assessment

Math, English

In 2016-2017, students in Montana took the SBAC assessment, which measures grades 3-8 in ELA and Math.

Note: To provide an at-a-glance view of proficiency at this school, we calculate an overall test score for each subject weighted by the number of students tested in each grade.

Source: Montana Office of Public Instruction, 2017

% suspended

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

% chronically absent

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Missing a race or ethnicity? When the population of a subgroup is too small to provide reliable data, it does not show up in the display. This may cause certain races/ethnicities to not be included in some charts within this section.

How do we come up with the race/ethnicity labels? We display the language used by the State Department of Education to describe student race/ethnicity information.

  • The “All students” number displayed represents the number of students at the school who participated in testing.
  • The “% of students” information reflects the portion of the overall student population at the school that each subgroup represents. For more about student demographics at this school, visit the “Students” section below.

How do we decide which subjects to display? Test subjects shown represent those taken by the largest number of students at this school.

Still have questions? Visit our FAQ page.

{"title":"Low-income students","anchor":"Low-income_students","analytics_id":"EquityLowIncome","subtitle":"Want low-income kids to get a fair shake? These 5 simple things will help you advocate for all students. ","info_text":"The low-income rating reflects state test scores for students at this school who qualify for free or reduced-price lunch compared to all students in the state. Learn more about this rating. ","icon_classes":"icon-pie","sources":"

GreatSchools profile data sources & information

GreatSchools Low-income Rating

The low-income rating reflects state test scores for students at this school who qualify for free or reduced-price lunch compared to all students in the state.

Source: GreatSchools; this rating was calculated in 2019 | See more: About this rating

Smarter Balanced Assessment

Math, English

In 2016-2017, students in Montana took the SBAC assessment, which measures grades 3-8 in ELA and Math.

Note: To provide an at-a-glance view of proficiency at this school, we calculate an overall test score for each subject weighted by the number of students tested in each grade.

Source: Montana Office of Public Instruction, 2017

% suspended

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

% chronically absent

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

","rating":1,"data":[{"title":"Test scores","anchor":"Test_scores","data":[{"narration":"

Very concerning:

Test scores for low income students at this school fall far below the state average for all students.

Parent tips

Low-income kids are really being left behind at this school. But some schools are doing an excellent job of serving all students. This toolkit will help you close the equity gap at your school:... More
  • Find out: what the heck is equity, anyway?
  • 6 things the best high schools do to help low-income kids.
  • How well is your school serving low income kids, compared to other schools near you?
  • 5 things to ask your principal
  • Share what you’ve learned with your principal
","type":"rating","values":[{"breakdown":"All students","breakdown_in_english":"All students","label":null,"score":1,"percentage":null,"display_percentages":true,"link":"/compare?breakdown=All+students&gradeLevels%5B%5D=p&gradeLevels%5B%5D=e&id=351&lat=48.058113&lon=-106.046921&sort=testscores&state=MT"},{"breakdown":"Low-income","breakdown_in_english":"Economically disadvantaged","label":null,"score":1,"percentage":"100","display_percentages":true,"link":"/compare?breakdown=Low-income&gradeLevels%5B%5D=p&gradeLevels%5B%5D=e&id=351&lat=48.058113&lon=-106.046921&sort=testscores&state=MT"}],"flagged":null,"title":"Overview","anchor":"Overview"}]},{"title":"Graduation rates","anchor":"Graduation_rates","data":[]}],"faq":{"cta":"Notice something missing or confusing?","content":"

How do we decide which subjects to display? We display the three tests taken by the largest number of students at this school.

Note: The “All students” number displayed represents the number of students at the school who participated in testing. The Low-income “% of students” information represents the portion of overall students at the school who are from low-income families.

  • For more information about low-income definitions, see the “?” at the top of the module.
  • For more about overall student demographics at this school, visit the “Students” section below.

Learn more about this rating

Still have questions? Visit our FAQ page.

How do we decide which subjects to display? We display the three tests taken by the largest number of students at this school.

What does the “State average” data show? In this chart, the state average show the state average for Students with disabilities (not for all students) across the state. This allows you to compare results for students with disabilities at this school to similar student populations at other schools in the state.

Still have questions? Visit our FAQ page.

div.div: Percentage of teachers with 3 or more years experience
% of full time teachers who are certified

a.data-content-html:
GreatSchools profile data sources & information

Students per teacher

The average number of students per full-time teacher at this school; please note that this is not a reflection of average class size.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Students per counselor

The average number of students per counselor at this school.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Percentage of teachers with 3 or more years experience

The percentage of full-time teachers at this school who have been teaching for 3 or more years.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

% of full time teachers who are certified

The percentage of full-time teachers at this school who have met all applicable state standard teacher certification requirements.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Average teacher salary

The average salary for full-time teachers at this school.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Nurse

This indicates if this school has a part-time, full-time or no registered nurse on staff.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Psychologist

This indicates if this school has a part-time, full-time or no licensed psychologist on staff.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Social worker

This indicates if this school has a part-time, full-time or no licensed social worker on staff.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Law enforcement officer

This indicates if this school has a part-time, full-time or no sworn law officer on campus.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

Security guard

This indicates if this school has a part-time, full-time or no security guard on staff.

Source: Civil Rights Data Collection, 2016

div.p: GreatSchools is the leading national nonprofit empowering parents to unlock educational opportunities for their children. We provide school information and parenting resources to help millions of American families choose the right school, support learning at home, and guide their children to great futures.

br.p: Support GreatSchools in this effort! Donate Now!
